entry.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin and Ethereum Rise, Solana Rises Most
entry.summary: All of the top 20 coins were in the green again—and nothing rose bigger than Solana, which is rebounding from its FTX-triggered losses.

entry.title: Nearly $700M Worth of Assets Linked to Sam Bankman-Fried, FTX Seized by US
entry.summary: The assets, including more than 55 million shares in Robinhood, were seized as part of the case against the FTX founder and former CEO.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Faced Security Threat at Parents' Home, Lawyers Claim
entry.summary: The FTX founder's attorneys claim that men drove a car into the barricade at his parents' California home, where he’s under house arrest.

entry.title: Bitcoin Surges to Five-Month Peak Above $22,500 as Market Rebounds
entry.summary: This week's Bitcoin pump reaches new recent heights, plus Ethereum, Solana, Dogecoin, and others are also soaring.

entry.title: SEC Charges Mango Markets Attacker With Manipulating Price of ‘Security’
entry.summary: Avraham Eisenberg, who boasted of the October scheme, now faces charges from the SEC in addition to the U.S. Justice Department and CFTC.

entry.title: Coinbase, Circle Back Former FTX US President’s New Crypto Venture
entry.summary: Harrison told Decrypt about the latest $5 million raise for his project Architect and called an FTX reboot an “interesting possibility.”

entry.title: FTX Bankruptcy Judge Calls Fmr FTX US Exec's Allegations Against Law Firm 'Hearsay, Innuendo, Speculation, Rumors'
entry.summary: The FTX bankruptcy judge approved the hiring of law firm Sullivan & Cromwell, despite objections made to the firm based on conflicts of interest.

entry.title: Gemini, Hedge Funds, and a DeFi App: Bankrupt Genesis Reveals List of Creditors
entry.summary: Genesis owes $3.6 billion to 50 different creditors including investment firms, hedge funds, and at least one consumer-facing DeFi app.

entry.title: Trouble in Ethereum? Devs Divided Over Staking Withdrawals in Shanghai Upgrade
entry.summary: Some of the network’s architects have expressed concern that the upgrade is launching too quickly for fear of public pressure over staking withdrawals.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Enjoy Bullish Week as Crypto Market Adds $77B
entry.summary: Despite the midweek correction, Bitcoin and Ethereum are enjoying impressive rallies over the past seven days.

entry.title: Winklevoss Mulls Lawsuit Against Barry Silbert, Digital Currency Group
entry.summary: Crypto exchange Gemini threatens to “imminently” sue Digital Currency Group and its CEO Barry Silbert over the $900 million owed by Genesis Trading.

entry.title: Genesis Files for Bankruptcy, Has $150 Million In the Bank
entry.summary: The company was battered by the fall of Three Arrows Capital and FTX and is under fire from the SEC.

entry.title: Ransomware Payments 'Significantly Down' in 2022: Chainalysis
entry.summary: Cyberattacks netted 40% less in 2022 than in the previous year, but not because criminals stood down.

entry.title: Nexo Settles with SEC, Will Pay $45 Million and Kill Crypto Lending Product
entry.summary: Extending a rough start to 2023, the crypto lender is settling with regulators over its "Earn Interest" product

entry.title: Trump NFTs Back From the Dead: Daily Sales Surge by 800%
entry.summary: After collapsing demand, former U.S. president Trump's digital trading cards are on the rise again. What’s happening?

entry.title: Jamie Dimon Thinks Bitcoin Supply Won’t Really Be Capped at 21 Million
entry.summary: There is no such thing as a sure thing, but five lines of crypto code come pretty close.

entry.title: ‘Creator Royalties Must Be Respected,’ Says Bored Ape Creator as Some Sewer Pass NFT Trades Blocked
entry.summary: The limited NFTs have racked up $19 million worth of trades, but Yuga Labs is excluding some marketplaces.

entry.title: Robinhood Rolls Out Its MetaMask Wallet Competitor to 1 Million Users
entry.summary: Robinhood’s Crypto GM says the wallet will function as a “browser” for Web3.

entry.title: FTX Token FTT Pumps 32% After New CEO Says Exchange Could Be Revived
entry.summary: Traders doing trader things with FTT.

entry.title: L'Oréal’s NYX Makeup Brand to Launch DAO, Ethereum NFTs to ‘Redefine Beauty’
entry.summary: NYX wants to create a crypto-savvy community of aesthetic enthusiasts—but will it stick?

entry.title: Compass Sued Over Allegedly Failing to Return Customer Bitcoin Miners
entry.summary: The case has been dismissed without prejudice, and the plaintiffs have until February 3 to file again.

entry.title: DeFi Project 1inch Network Launches Hardware Wallet
entry.summary: 1inch's hardware wallet will support the same cryptocurrencies available on the firm's hot wallet and offers multi-seed phrase functionality.

entry.title: gm: Big Bold Predictions for Crypto in 2023
entry.summary: Will Sam Bankman-Fried serve prison time? Who will be the next crypto company to go bankrupt, or the next founder to see their reputation dissolve? Will we get a new crypto law this year? Decrypt's Dan Roberts, Stacy Elliott, and Matthew Diemer of the gm podcast crew kicked off the new year by trading predictions for 2023. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Revolut ‘Assessing The Best Time’ for Native RevCoin Launch
entry.summary: Revolut has hinted at a native token for some time. Now the firm is mulling when to launch RevCoin "in the coming months," a spokesperson said.

entry.title: OKX Reveals $7.2B of 'Clean' Assets in Latest Proof-of-Reserves Report
entry.summary: OKX’s fresh Proof-of-Reserves report says the crypto exchange boasts $7.2 billion in assets, none of which include its native token.

entry.title: National Australia Bank to Launch Stablecoin on Ethereum, Algorand: Report
entry.summary: The National Australia Bank announced that it will soon launch a new stablecoin backed by the Australian dollar on Ethereum and Algorand.

entry.title: Dogecoin, Bonk and Shiba Inu Combine for $25 Billion in Monthly Trading Volume
entry.summary: Despite a massive decline from their all-time highs, the three tokens still have considerable trading volume.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Insists Bankruptcy Team Is Wrong About FTX US Insolvency
entry.summary: The FTX founder and former CEO claims the restructuring team's own documents prove that FTX US is "fully solvent."

entry.title: Genesis Bankruptcy Filing Imminent as Creditor Negotiations Stall: Reports
entry.summary: The crypto lender could file for bankruptcy protection as soon as this week following fallout from the FTX contagion.

entry.title: Crypto Panics, Then Jeers at DOJ Announcement of 'Major Action' Against Tiny Chinese Exchange Bitzlato
entry.summary: BTC and ETH dropped in anticipation of a major announcement from federal prosecutors that many thought would target a major player in crypto. It didn't.

entry.title: Are Falling Wholesale Prices Good for Bitcoin?
entry.summary: Supplier-level inflation slowed in December, bolstering expectations of lower interest rate hikes from the Federal Reserve.

entry.title: Metahood Raises $3M to Build the Zillow of the Metaverse
entry.summary: Want to scope out property in the metaverse? Metahood is creating a platform for buying and selling virtual real estate.

entry.title: Bitget Leads Drive for Crypto Exchange Security With $300M Protection Fund
entry.summary: Auditable protection funds and beefed-up proof of reserves are among the new compliance measures introduced by the derivatives trading platform.

entry.title: You Can Now Earn Bitcoin By Playing Chess on Your Phone
entry.summary: As play-to-earn games evolve, Zebedee is returning to the classics.

entry.title: Bitcoin Miner GRIID’s NYSE Arrival Delayed Again
entry.summary: The latest delay could see the roughly $3.3 billion SPAC that Bitcoin miner GRIID intends to merge with leave the NYSE.

entry.title: Suspects in UK Bitcoin Fraud Had ‘More Money Than They Could Spend’: Lancashire Police
entry.summary: Reports say the group made off with so much money that the leader of the Bitcoin fraud bought cars for people that they met at the bar.

entry.title: Nearly Half of SEC Crypto Enforcement Actions in 2022 Were Against ICOs
entry.summary: In 2022, the SEC brought a total of 30 cryptocurrency-related enforcement actions, of which 14 were related to Initial Coin Offerings.

entry.title: Coinbase Announces 'Difficult Decision' to Shutter Operations in Japan
entry.summary: Coinbase confirmed that it would be shuttering operations in Japan, asking users to withdraw any funds by February 16.

entry.title: SHIB Leads Crypto Markets, Soaring More Than 15% Overnight
entry.summary: The crypto market's second-largest meme coin by market cap Shiba Inu (SHIB) has enjoyed a hefty overnight rally of more than 15%.

entry.title: Did It Really Take Just 13 People To Hard Fork Polygon?
entry.summary: The manner in which Polygon's leadership handled a major upgrade has some questioning its commitment to decentralization.

entry.title: $90 Million in FTX US Assets Were Moved via 'Unauthorized Transfers' After Bankruptcy
entry.summary: Although the movement of funds made headlines, the $90 million from FTX US had not been previously disclosed.

entry.title: Walking the Red Carpet at The Crypties 2022
entry.summary: Sander on the Street is back! Decrypt's Sander Lutz walked the red carpet and accosted attendees as they arrived at the inaugural Crypties awards gala in December 2022 at Art Basel in Miami, presented by Decrypt Studios.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Highlight Reel
entry.summary: In December 2022 at Art Basel in Miami, Decrypt Studios held the inaugural Crypties awards gala. With emcee Josh Ostrovsky ("The Fat Jewish") and presenters from a range of crypto projects, statuettes were awarded in nine categories. The evening was sponsored by Polygon, Filecoin Foundation, Lamina1, Async, BeetsDAO, The Gold Mask, Gem Set, Breakout, Anonymous, Infinite Objects, Ape Water, Decentralized Pictures, and Vault 721.

entry.title: gm: Zora Looks Beyond NFTs to DAO Creation
entry.summary: Zora sees itself as more than just an NFT marketplace; its next era is about helping people easily launch a DAO. Zora Co-founder Jacob Horne joined Dan Roberts and Andrew Hayward to talk competition, the NFT speculative boom and bust, how Zora and Nouns are connected, and why Zora thinks DAOs are the future. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
